PhyMediumComments: black-and-white: Ansco Superpan Press safety film
CatDescriptText: Mr. Ernest Rose, 43D Midway Drive, Whitaker, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, February 8, 1958, pg. 2 with question: "Should jitney drivers be licensed and permitted to operate, or should they be jailed?" answer reads: "They should be licensed. That way, if anything happens to you, you would have some comeback- some insurance to rely on.  Also, at times you cannot get a cab, and a jitney will provide you the service."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Ernest Rose wearing dark hat, zippered jacket, and pinstriped pants, standing with hands in pockets in front of Marsh Wheeling, Liberty Avenue, Downtown
